tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE health_monitoring_data (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    heart_rate INT,
    body_temperature FLOAT,
    steps_count INT,
    sleep_quality INT
);

CREATE TABLE WearableDevices (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    device_type VARCHAR(255),
    user_id INT,
    recorded_data JSONB
);

CREATE TABLE UserHealthData (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    heart_rate INT,
    blood_pressure JSONB,
    steps_count INT,
    recorded_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE health_data (
    data_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT REFERENCES users(user_id),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    heart_rate INT,
    steps INT,
    calories_burned FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE sleep_data (
    sleep_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT REFERENCES users(user_id),
    date DATE NOT NULL,
    hours_slept FLOAT,
    sleep_quality INT
);

CREATE TABLE wearables_data (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    data_type VARCHAR(50),
    recorded_at TIMESTAMP,
    data_value FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_name VARCHAR(50),
    age INT,
    gender VARCHAR(10),
    contact_no VARCHAR(15)
);

CREATE TABLE devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50),
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    manufacturer VARCHAR(50),
    purchase_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE wearable_devices (
	sensor_id INT,
	sensor_type VARCHAR,
	device_id INT,
	timestamp TIMESTAMP,
	data_value FLOAT,
	PRIMARY KEY (sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE users (
	user_id INT,
	name VARCHAR,
	age INT,
	gender VARCHAR,
	height FLOAT,
	weight FLOAT,
	PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE sleep_data (
	sensor_id INT,
	sleep_quality INT,
	sleep_duration FLOAT,
	PRIMARY KEY (sensor_id),
	FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES wearable_devices(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE steps_data (
	sensor_id INT,
	step_count INT,
	distance FLOAT,
	calories_burned FLOAT,
	PRIMARY KEY (sensor_id),
	FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES wearable_devices(sensor_id)
);
